metadata.title: CVE-2022-3661 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in Extensions in Google Chrome prior to107.0.5304.62 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the rendererprocess to leak cross-origin data via a crafted Chrome extension. (Chromiumsecurity severity: Low)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3661` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1').
